questions.q: When setting up a webpage, what purpose does the `DOCTYPE` serve?

choices.a: Tells search engine what your page is about
choices.b: Tells the browser what HTML version you are using
choices.d: Tells the browser what CSS version you are using

questions.q: What is the preferred method of including JavaScript on a webpage?

choices.a: Include JavaScript inline with HTML elements (i.e. in an `onclick` attribute)
choices.b: Include JavaScript within a `<script>` tag, but in the same file as HTML
choices.c: Include JavaScript in a different file and pull it in using a `<script>` tag

questions.q: How can we interact with the Document Object Model in a JavaScript application?

choices.c: We must have a library like jQuery to interact with the DOM
choices.d: There is no way to interact directly with the DOM in JavaScript

questions.q: For what reason did developers abandon original JS methods of selecting DOM elements (i.e. `getElementById`)?

choices.b: They behaved differently in other browsers
